text.headline: School
text.text:
The 1-9 class in the usual school.
What should i say here? The computer-course was a bit boring, and "blackscreen-viruses" i've supported where often stuff like no power-cable for the screen. In the 8. year, i had fun with the OptixPro-Trojan. I made computers crazy and deleted porno-folders, but i also told this to my victims (and friends) and they took it easy :)

text.headline: First own computer
text.text:
20 Mb Harddrive, "modern" floppy-disks, Windows 3.1 and not even a megaherz of power - but it was still interessting.
My parents made me the restriction, that i had to disassemble and assemble the computer again with my bigger half-brother, before i get it - this was something, what interessted me anyway.. ;)

text.headline: Work with windows
text.text: Regedit, cmd, bluescreens and the first genuine-products. Windows 95 to XP was a interessting time - there was always something to fix.

text.headline: Additional schoolyear
text.text:
The 10. year of school.
This was extending my basic knowledge, also when i extended it may more for php and perl instead of the office-course.e

text.headline: The begin of developing
text.text: My first "Hello World" was written in Perl. Soon and also because of the similiar syntax, i also explored PHP.

text.headline: Change to linux
text.text:
With Windows XP, i gave up Microsoft's world and changed to something, that i like by it's friendly philosophie - Linux!
I've tried a lot of distros; Mandrivia, OpenSuse, Ubuntu, Fedora and Slack. My first really used distro was OpenSuse.
A main-change for me was, that some stuff, that works not out of the box, can hard to fix (in this time, wlan with Windows-drivers, for example), but when you get it working stable once, it will work all time the same.
With Windows, i had expiriences like a bluescreen of death on every boot, without any changes to other times it booted.
Also the complete update-system from linux was something new and positive to me.

text.headline: Change to Gentoo Linux
text.text:
Gentoo is a quite complicated distro, but it's named after the fastest penguin and works like this (when you get it controlled ;)).
In the begin of my developer-education, we tried the distro - i was helping a lot of people to surround theyr kernel-panic.

text.headline: Use of Kubuntu, Raspbian and other Debian-derivates
text.text: For usual users, i began early to use Kubuntu, because it have new Software and is easy to support. Also i love KDE since Version 3, so not Ubuntu (Kde just looks more like Windows by default. This helps to change). After i had enough compiling with my Gentoo, i also changed personaly to Kubuntu. In a short time (~6 months) in between i also used Arch Linux.

text.headline: Developer-education
text.text:
I made a swiss-approved education as software-developer at Puzzle ITC.
There i had to do the common code in java and groovy & grails - this learns me object oriented thinking.
In my free time, i learned python and qt. Also in php i had my projects.

text.headline: Röck'n'Röll-Krew
text.text:
Work as stagehand. Moving speakers, laying carpets, putting LED-screens together...
The various tasks and to see, what happens behind the stage before (sometimes even while) it goes rock n'roll, was interessting.

text.headline: Creative personal
text.text: Heavier work, more climbing. A scaffolder for events, building mainly stages. Was a nice time!

text.headline: Microcontroller-development
text.text: Begin to make Stuff with Arduino's, for example i made code for home-automation, but didn't release it yet. Also, i first developed a gui with python and pyqt. After this, i made the gui with Qt for a client, which wanted performance for a testing tool - so i've learned C++ on the fly. This change allows me to compile the project for android and if needed also ipone's or windows mobile's.

text.headline: Developing a encrypted tracking-websystem-frontend
text.text: For a company, i had/have temporary jobs for developing a part of their product. The whole developing of a end-to-end encrypted map was a really interessting task, which needs newer technologies as well (webcrypto for example). When other products tells about 'military grade encryption' with aes256, i can say it from my (developed) product as well :)
